data.title: PRS gets 2 extra seats, names for Sarawak polls finalised
data.meta_description:
This article first appeared in The Edge Financial Daily, on January 13, 2016.

 

KUCHING: Parti Rakyat Sarawak (PRS) has been allocated two new seats for the upcoming state elections, said its president Tan Sri Dr James Masing.

He said PRS had been given...
data.text:
This article first appeared in The Edge Financial Daily, on January 13, 2016.

KUCHING: Parti Rakyat Sarawak (PRS) has been allocated two new seats for the upcoming state elections, said its president Tan Sri Dr James Masing.

He said PRS had been given the Murum and Samalaju seats, which were among the 11 new seats created in the redelineation exercise last year.

Masing said he submitted the PRS candidate list to state Barisan Nasional (BN) chief Tan Sri Adenan Satem last Tuesday, which he endorsed.

“The PRS nominated candidates were introduced on the same day to the chief minister in his office in Wisma Bapa Malaysia,” Masing said in a statement yesterday, referring to Adenan, who is also the chief minister of Sarawak.

He did not disclose who the candidates were and said he was leaving it to Adenan to announce their names.

Masing had said all incumbents, with the exception of Tamin assemblyman Datuk Joseph Mauh, would be defending their seats.

The other seats which the party’s candidates will defend are Baleh, Belaga, Murum, Kakus, Ngemah, Batang Ai, Bukit Begunan and Balai Ringin.

Adenan had on New Year’s Eve hinted that the state polls would be held in three months’ time.
